articles.title: Vance says administration is pausing some Medicaid funding to Minnesota because of fraud concerns
articles.description:
The vice president said the administration was taking the action “in order to ensure that the state of Minnesota takes its obligations seriously to be good stewards of the American people’s tax money.”

The post Vance says administration is pausing some Medicaid funding to Minnesota because of fraud concerns appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Administration pauses Medicaid funding to Minnesota due to fraud concerns.
Vice President Vance emphasizes accountability for taxpayer money.
Potential ripple effects could impact Medicaid services for Boston residents.

articles.title: New Edition, Phil Collins, Lauryn Hill, INXS, Iron Maiden, Luther Vandross and Shakira get Rock Hall nominations
articles.description:
Billy Idol, Joy Division/New Order return to the nominations after missing induction last year.

The post New Edition, Phil Collins, Lauryn Hill, INXS, Iron Maiden, Luther Vandross and Shakira get Rock Hall nominations appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: New Edition receives Rock Hall nomination, highlighting Boston's rich music legacy.
Billy Idol and Joy Division/New Order return to nominations after previous year's absence.
Local fans can support nominees by voting in the upcoming Rock Hall induction.

articles.title: Mass. school districts cancel classes through Friday amid power outages, snow cleanup
articles.description:
Schools along Cape Cod and in southeastern Massachusetts are battling power outages, poor road conditions, and snow removal challenges following Monday’s blizzard.

The post Mass. school districts cancel classes through Friday amid power outages, snow cleanup appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Massachusetts school districts cancel classes through Friday due to ongoing power outages and snow cleanup.
Cape Cod and southeastern Massachusetts face significant road conditions following Monday's blizzard.
Local residents may experience disruptions in childcare and work schedules due to school closures.

articles.title: Man threatens another bus passenger with a gun in East Boston, police say
articles.description:
The 26-year-old was carrying a .40-caliber Beretta and had a prior conviction for illegal possession of a firearm, authorities say.

The post Man threatens another bus passenger with a gun in East Boston, police say appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: A 26-year-old man threatened a bus passenger with a gun in East Boston.
The suspect was armed with a .40-caliber Beretta and had a prior firearm conviction.
This incident raises concerns about public safety on Boston's public transportation.
